alert.note: Alert for Broward (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 27 at 8:26PM EDT until September 27 at 10:30PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: The National Weather Service in Miami has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Broward County in southeastern Florida... * Until 1030 PM EDT. * At 826 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fort Lauderdale, Hollywood, Davie, Plantation, Sunrise, Lauderhill, Lauderdale Lakes, Cooper City, Pine Island Ridge, Nova Southeastern University, Broadview Park, Sunshine Acres, Sawgrass Mills Mall, Melrose Park, St. George, Chambers Estates, Downtown Davie and Broward Estates. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
